bio: Aubrey Beardsley was an English illustrator and author who is known for his controversial and ornate black and white drawings. He was born in 1872 and died at a young age in 1898, but his work had a significant impact on the art world during his lifetime. Beardsley was associated with the Aesthetic movement, which emphasized beauty and art for art's sake. His work is characterized by its elaborate and ornate style, and he is known for his illustrations of literature and classical mythology.
